project_description: A simple Flutter application that switches between displaying 'Cat' with a clock icon and 'Dog' with a clock icon when the text is clicked, using the Cubit pattern for state management.
architecture_overview: The project follows the Cubit pattern for state management, separating the application into different layers including presentation (widgets), business logic (cubits), and data (models). The lib directory is structured to keep these layers organized.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant HomeScreen
participant AnimalCubit
participant AnimalState
User -> HomeScreen: click
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> AnimalState: update state
AnimalState -> HomeScreen: emit new state
HomeScreen -> User: display new animal
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. The HomeScreen listens to the AnimalCubit for state changes. When the user clicks on the text, the AnimalCubit toggles the state between 'Cat' and 'Dog'. The new state is emitted and the HomeScreen re-renders with the new state.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen (HomeScreen) that displays the current animal. There is no complex navigation structure in this simple application.
